meanings.definition: In a manner relating to the law or legal matters.
meanings.sent1: The lawyer argued juristically in court, citing relevant statutes and precedents.
meanings.sent2: She approached the case juristically, analyzing the legal implications thoroughly.
meanings.sent3: The judge humorously remarked that the parrot in the courtroom was behaving juristically.
meanings.sent4: The concept of justice was painted juristically on the canvas of the legal system.
meanings.sent5: The legal seminar aimed to make the complexities of the law more understandable by explaining them juristically.

meanings.definition: In a way that pertains to the administration of justice.
meanings.sent1: The police officer acted juristically, ensuring fair treatment for all involved.
meanings.sent2: The organization's policies were designed to operate juristically and uphold fairness.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's mission was to fight crime juristically, bringing villains to justice.
meanings.sent4: The scales of justice tipped juristically in favor of the innocent defendant.
meanings.sent5: The courtroom drama portrayed the struggle between good and evil juristically, with justice prevailing in the end.
